TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PropertyData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents information about a WMI property.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_OperatingSystem** class using the PropertyData class. For more information about **Win32_OperatingSystem**, see the Windows Management Instrumentation documentation in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
[!code-vb[wminet_PropertyData#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.management.prop_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[wminet_PropertyData#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.management.prop_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the property is an array.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.Boolean> value indicating whether the property is an array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `true` if the property is an array; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the property has been defined in the current WMI class.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.Boolean> value indicating whether the property has been defined in the current WMI class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value `true` if the property has been defined in the current WMI class; otherwise, `false`.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the property.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the property name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A string containing the name of the property.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_OperatingSystem** class using the <xref:System.Management.PropertyData> class. For more information about **Win32_OperatingSystem**, see the Windows Management Instrumentation documentation in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the WMI class in the hierarchy in which the property was introduced.
Docs.value: Returns a <xref:System.String> value containing the name of the WMI class in the hierarchy in which the property was introduced.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A string containing the name of the originating WMI class.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the set of qualifiers defined on the property.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the set of qualifiers defined on the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A <xref:System.Management.QualifierDataCollection> that represents the set of qualifiers defined on the property.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
